description: Erection of a two storey rear extension including a rear dormer with 3 roof lights; erection of a first floor side extension; excavation of the basement to create habitable room with the formation of front and rear light wells; and the replacement of the roof covering.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA CA12 : Streatham Park Garrads Road Conservation Area

decision_conditions: The proposed first floor side extension would result in unacceptable alteration to the roof form and unbalance the symmetrical form of the main roof. Consequently, the proposal would fail to adequately preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the host dwelling and the wider Streatham Park and Garrads Road Conservation Area. The less than substantial harm identified to the conservation area would not be outweighed by any public benefits of the scheme. The proposal therefore fails to comply with the Lambeth's Design Guide SPD (2023) and policies Q5, Q11 and Q22 of the Lambeth Local Plan 2020-2035 (2021) and paragraph 202 of the NPPF.

The proposed lightwells associated with the excavation of a basement level would represent an incongruous and uncharacteristic feature of the host building and the wider Streatham Park and Garrads Road Conservation Area. The less than substantial harm identified to the conservation area would not be outweighed by any public benefits of the scheme.  The proposal therefore fails to comply with the Lambeth's Design Guide SPD (2023) and policies Q5, Q11, Q22 and Q27 of the Lambeth Local Plan 2020-2035 (2021) and paragraph 202 of the NPPF.

The submitted Basement Impact Assessment fails to comply with Lambeth Local Plan 2020 - 2035 (2021) Policy Q27 as it was not undertaken by a suitably qualified professional and fails to capture all issues relevant to the proposal.

The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of an adequate arboricultural survey that existing trees would be protected and retained by the development. The proposal therefore fails to comply with policy Q10 of the Local Plan 2020 - 2035 (2021).
